channel.title: Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave
channel.description:
About time I say goodbye to these forums, I've been considering it for a while. No point in participating in a community where your sole purpose is to contribute to it, but the other members don't recognize that. Too much flaming, spam, Moparscape is out-dated. Rarely do I see people positively supporting members and their projects, unless however, they're a member that has been here for some period of time. Moparscape is predominantly ran by older members, who shut down the new members, who try to benefit the community. Most of you (I cannot speak for all, there are some good members in the Moparscape community), see someone trying to contribute to the community, if it's a bad idea, or you don't like it, or that person, you strive to find something negative to say. Instead of trying to be positive, and wishing the person good luck anyways. Everyone starts at different skill levels, when it comes to website development, server development, networking, graphics, whatever it may be, whether you are a professional, or not. We [i]all [/i]started at the stage of, "not knowing [i]anything[/i]." And to constantly see people shutting others down, especially the new members of the community, really is disappointing. It's funny, as I'm composing this, and as some people are reading the title, they'll see the subject, "Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave." And they'll take note of the author, "The Web Guy" do they like me? Yes? No? I'm already expecting comments like, "just leave already" or, "no one cares" or even, "you didn't contribute to the community anyways." That's fine, I don't take it offensively, especially because most of them didn't even read this whole paragraph. I had an alright time with the community, tried to contribute what I could, but continuously got shut down by older members. Therefore, goodbye Moparscape, and the few good community members on these boards. What once started as (from my knowledge) a JAVA-based community, opened gates to graphics, website development, etc. Then led the way and opened doors for Runescape Private Servers. It was once this great leader and resource, where people can find help, and get the answers they need, from a friendly community. It has now, very sadly, turned into what it is now. And for fun, and making a point, let me show you the types of things that demotivate those trying to learn and excel. [b]** These are quotes from recent posts, names have been removed.[/b] Scenario: A user trying to create a Wiki for RSPS.
Kinda useless.. but you never know.
Scenario: A user trying to get suggestions on a RSPS template.
l2searchbar
(Though it's a simple question, people feel the need to troll, and make others feel un-welcomed. Scenario: A user trying to create a top-list site, to benefit the RSPS community.
-says he is going to make a toplist -can't add proper links...
I could quote hundreds and hundreds of scenarios where people are being shut down and denied. If you want some real examples of how bad Moparscape can get, checkout the Debates board, or Intellectual Debates. On a very final note, Those of you striving to keep the community together, good job. Those of you new members being shut down, try to ignore what others say. Those old members out there, who think they run everything, don't get so big-headed, there's honestly no benefit from it. I can only note a short list of members that are higher up in the community, that still maintain a level of kindness to newer members. I sincerely thank those on this list (this isn't all, I'm sure that I'm leaving a few out.) * Don't think I'm favoring anyone, some of these people on the list are friends, some I've never talked to. Arham4 Frell Justaguy Tutorial RiiPiiNFtW Scape-JAVA JavaTC Cres AtomicInt_ Also, a quick little list of people who really need to stop trying to troll. Lin Vain_ Java-RSPS-Noob LilXCj Team_Rocket Tyb97 Arcik chillwitm888 Acorn_ Whackatre And one more list, power-happy moderators. (inb4 I get banned for this list, because mods get all in their feelings.) Deathschaos9 -- That's about it. I'll come out and say this, Deathschaos9 banned an old Moparscape account of mine, purely for the reasoning being that I wouldn't develop for his server. Take care Moparscape community, though the community and it's members, will die down at an exponential rate. [size=14pt][i][b]** Almost forgot! Let the flaming, trolling, hatred, and immaturity begin in the comments![/b][/i][/size]

item.title: Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:1, topic:532350”]And one more list, power-happy moderators. (inb4 I get banned for this list, because mods get all in their feelings.)
Deathschaos9

– That’s about it. I’ll come out and say this, Deathschaos9 banned an old Moparscape account of mine, purely for the reasoning being that I wouldn’t develop for his server.[/quote]

Well that’s rather hilarious; ‘Power-happy’. Me? You’ve either taken a large object to the side of your head or you’ve seriously got your moderators mixed up.
Not to mention you reasoning behind me banning an old account of yours is absolutely ridiculous. I’ve almost always been a solo developer and I’ve rarely asked anyone to develop for me and I certainly haven’t banned anyone for refusing to help me. Anyone whose talked to me for more than five minutes will tell you I’m easygoing and laid back, but whatever you want to believe I guess.

This topic is just… :palm:

Edit:
Almost forgot…

Rules of this Board

[ul][li]No more “leaving”, “sympathy”, or “coming back” topics (but introduction topics are still allowed and encouraged :))[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

Anyways, I never really knew you, but bye i guess.

item.title: Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:15, topic:532350”][quote author=Spades link=topic=651141.msg4368022#msg4368022 date=1380061573]
Mind providing us a link so we can see what you’re working on?
[/quote]

I don’t wish to share anything with anyone on Moparscape. Will bring negativity to the development. In a few years down the road, you may see it.

[quote author=Null Amount link=topic=651141.msg4368023#msg4368023 date=1380061593]
Complains about members shutting down other members for not knowing something.

Quote from: Illadelph on December 16, 2012, 11:44:39 PM

do all those // methods use up memory?

// methods
methods[/quote]

I suppose you caught me there, that signature is fairly old anyways. One of the few instances where I’ve done something like that. On a side note, I completely forgot to add you to the list, damn.

i hope you don’t get butthurt when you see nobody cares/misses you.

It’s funny, as I’m composing this, and as some people are reading the title, they’ll see the subject, “Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave.” And they’ll take note of the author, “The Web Guy” do they like me? Yes? No? I’m already expecting comments like, “just leave already” or, “no one cares” or even, “you didn’t contribute to the community anyways.” That’s fine, I don’t take it offensively, especially because most of them didn’t even read this whole paragraph.

And no, not http://imagination.com haven’t set up a URL. I’ve been building a support base from those interested, as well as a development team. With my plans and steps laid out, you’ll be surprised how many people will support, especially without seeing no more progress other than the very basic start of a home page.

2091q9h.png960×475
[/quote]wait i actually like that social network on facebook l0l

Read full topic

item.title: Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:17, topic:532350”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=651141.msg4368029#msg4368029 date=1380061866]

Mind providing us a link so we can see what you’re working on?

I don’t wish to share anything with anyone on Moparscape. Will bring negativity to the development. In a few years down the road, you may see it.

[quote author=Null Amount link=topic=651141.msg4368023#msg4368023 date=1380061593]
Complains about members shutting down other members for not knowing something.

Quote from: Illadelph on December 16, 2012, 11:44:39 PM

do all those // methods use up memory?

// methods
methods[/quote]

I suppose you caught me there, that signature is fairly old anyways. One of the few instances where I’ve done something like that. On a side note, I completely forgot to add you to the list, damn.

i hope you don’t get butthurt when you see nobody cares/misses you.

It’s funny, as I’m composing this, and as some people are reading the title, they’ll see the subject, “Goodbye Moparscape, a Formal Leave.” And they’ll take note of the author, “The Web Guy” do they like me? Yes? No? I’m already expecting comments like, “just leave already” or, “no one cares” or even, “you didn’t contribute to the community anyways.” That’s fine, I don’t take it offensively, especially because most of them didn’t even read this whole paragraph.

[/quote]why wait a few years? if it’s growing so fast shouldnt we see it in a few days?
stop bullshitting everyone. that’s all you’ve ever done.

claimed to create template for w901. got caught. you made your own, and it sucked horribly.
you couldn’t ever take constructive criticism at all and you’ve never produced anything of good quality.

you didn’t produce any good website. and nobody is/will ever support you.

if you’re leaving, just do it. we don’t need to know that you’re leaving. and you’re clearly staying on the forums to see the replies; so obviously you do care about whether people will miss you or not.

seriously. just log off. and don’t come back. or suck it up. take the negativity. grow some balls. and be a part of moparscape.[/quote]

:palm: Development isn’t instantaneous, this is a recent development that I started. Sure, supporters can grow as fast as possible. It’s not going to be usable by the public in a matter of days. After a few years, development should be done, and open for public usage, and hopefully, just hopefully, it’ll be known.

Read full topic

Your rude comments are the reason you were put on that list in the first place. Don’t get butt hurt over it, kay.[/quote]being serious isn’t trolling. i’m not butthurt, and if you believe so; you are wrong.
